techmeme.title: Sources: Meta laid off ~100 people, at least the third such incremental layoff at Meta in 2024, separate from those let go for improper use of Grubhub credits (Kali Hays/Fortune)
Qualcomm cancels the Snapdragon Dev Kit, which was supposed to ship in June, and will offer refunds, as the product failed to meet its "standards of excellence" (Rich Woods/XDA Developers)
Abel, founded by Daniel Francis, or @growing_daniel on X, to build AI that uses body cam footage and other data to fill out police reports, raised a $5M seed (Margaux MacColl/TechCrunch)
Sources: Matt Mullenweg offered another buyout offer to Automattic staff; Mullenweg appears to have redirected staff's Blind sign-up emails to himself (Samantha Cole/404 Media)
Memo: Google will block US election ads after the polls close on November 5 to prevent misinfo about voting, including candidates prematurely claiming victory (Sara Fischer/Axios)
